name: UpdateNewsItem
description:
Updates information for a specific news item.

Call this tool to modify the details of an existing news item by its ID. Use it when you need to change or correct the content of a news article. The tool confirms whether the update was successful or not.

parameters.name: news_item_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the news item provided by Intercom.

value_schema.description: The unique identifier for the news item which is given by Intercom.

parameters.name: intercom_api_version
parameters.description: Specify the API version to use for this update. Options range from 1.0 to 2.9.

parameters.name: news_item_details
parameters.description: A detailed object containing the news item's title, body (with optional HTML), sender ID, state, labels, reactions, and newsfeed assignments. Customize how the news item appears and functions.

title.description: The title of the news item.

body.description: The news item body, which may contain HTML.

sender_id.description: The id of the sender of the news item. Must be a teammate on the workspace.

state.description: News items will not be visible to your users in the assigned newsfeeds until they are set live.

deliver_silently.description: When set to `true`, the news item will appear in the messenger newsfeed without showing a notification badge.

labels.description: Label names displayed to users to categorize the news item.

reactions.description: Ordered list of emoji reactions to the news item. When empty, reactions are disabled.

newsfeed_id.description: The unique identifier for the newsfeed which is given by Intercom. Publish dates cannot be in the future, to schedule news items use the dedicated feature in app (see this article).

published_at.description: Publish date of the news item on the newsfeed, use this field if you want to set a publish date in the past (e.g. when importing existing news items). On write, this field will be ignored if the news item state is "draft".

newsfeed_assignments.description: A list of newsfeed_assignments to assign to the specified newsfeed.
